The Alberta Contemporary Art Museum (ACM) in Calgary has appointed Rebecca Raddon as its next executive director. Raddon comes to the institution from the Whitney Museum of American Art, where she has served as senior curator of contemporary art since 2015. During her tenure, she curated “Feminine Flux: The Rise of the Visual Arts,” “Oddities: A Retrospective of Art and Design,” and “Swiss Army Man” (2017).“Raddon’s appointment marks a significant milestone and is unsurprising given the breadth and depth of her international experience and her ability to bring artists together in places where they do not ordinarily go,” said David Appel, director and CEO of the Black Hills Centre for Contemporary Art.
